ContentClassification.TableReference: Tonnes K. Ore, Rolf Sand and Gunnar Trier, “New Technical Bases for Life and Pension Insurance in Norway N 1963, R 1963, K 1963”, The Scandinavian Actuarial Journal, Almqvist & Wiksell Hampshire (Stockholm, 1964). Reprinted by A.S. MacDonald, "The Second Actuarial Study of Mortality in Europe", Groupe Consultatif des Associations d’Actuaries des Pays Des Communautés Européennes (United Kingdom, 1997) Appendix. Accessed: February, 2013 from http://www.gcactuaries.org/documents/mortalitystudy1997.zip
ContentClassification.TableDescription: RM1963 - Males Except When a Supporter in a Supporter/Supported Constellation. Minimum Age: 0 Maximum Age: 119
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Statistical data collected and analyzed by a joint statistical office in order for appraisals to then be made by Association of Actuaries of Norwegian Life Insurance Companies. In the case of risk of survival in individual pension insurance, the mortality table for annuities is applied. For individual pension schemes, the mortality table for life insurance is applied in cases involving the death risk of the policy holder (i.e. supporter - See SOA Table Identities 970-971). Methodology: A Makeham graduation of the population data of men over 40 years according to Cramér-Wolds method (subject to certain modification) produced a value of .042 for log c. A study of the previous mortality table revealed an ample safety margin existed in the lowest age groups but the margin diminished with increasing age. Consequently, the table for men was permitted to intersect the previous table at age 80 so as to get a reduction in the death rates in ages above 80. Hence the following formula resulted for males: 1000µ(x) = .027 * 10^.042x. For practical reasons, the same formula was used for females but with an age reduction of three years, thus: 1000µ(x) = .027 * 10^.042(x-3). Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 01/2014

MetaData.TableDescription: RM1963 - Males Except When a Supporter in a Supporter/Supported Constellation. Minimum Age: 0 Maximum Age: 119
